body:
Comment 1: 
You need all 32-bit build tools (8g, 8l, ...) to build linux-32 programs. If you have
downloaded binary go distro for windows-amd64, then you would not have these - you would
have all 64-bit tools (6g, 6l, ...) instead.

You could download windows-386 binary distro instead. It should still work on your
Windows 7 64 bit computer, but it will build 32-bit programs only.

Alternatively, you could download source files and mingw and build everything (8g, 8l,
6g, 6l, ... and all standard packages) yourself. Here are
http://code.google.com/p/go-wiki/wiki/WindowsCrossCompiling some instructions of mine
for building windows programs on linux. I think, you could do something similar on
windows.

Please, be warned that you can't use cgo when cross-compiling. In case of linux, it
means, you won't be able to build even standard net package.

Alex
_Owner changed to @alexbrainman._ _Status changed to **WaitingForReply**._
